ARAssetManager * assetManagerIfAvailable

Detailed Description

This is the main controller, connecting the model with the view classes for the main screen of the application. It controls the main dimension mode, as well as the QR scanner mode.

Member Function Documentation

- (void) createFeatureViews  

Ensure that the feature views for the overlays in the current dimension exist, and remove features that are no longer in the dimension.

- (void) createOverlayViews  

Ensure that the overlay views for the overlays in the current dimension exist, and remove overlays that are no longer in the dimension.

- (void) didEnterState: (int)  state  

Handle a state change, right after this state is entered. This function enables features and views, so that they match what is necessary in the new state. This function can assume that all features and view used by other views are already disabled or hidden.

Parameters:
state the newly entered state.
- (void) didLeaveState: (int)  state  

Handle a state change, right before this state is left. This function disables features and views unique to this state, so that the new state can assume there is nothing but a bare camera view.

Parameters:
state the state that will be left.
- (void) didTapAboutControllerCloseButton  

Handle the about window's close button being tapped.

- (void) didTapCancelButton  

Handle the cancel button being tapped.

- (void) didTapFeature: (ARFeatureView *)  view  

Handle a feature being tapped. Perform the corresponding action.

Parameters:
view the view for the feature that was tapped.
- (void) didTapMenuButton  

Handle the menu button being tapped.

- (void) didTapOverlay: (AROverlayView *)  view  

Handle an overlay being tapped. Perform the corresponding action.

Parameters:
view the view for the overlay that was tapped.
- (void) ensureStatusBarVisible  

Make the status bar visible if it is not already visible.

- (id) initWithURL: (NSURL *)  url  

Initialize the receiver with the given URL. If a URL is given, the controller will start loading the dimension at that URL as soon as it becomes visible.

Parameters:
url A URL to start loading a dimension from. May be nil.
Returns:
The receiver.
- (void) makeStatusBarVisible  

Make the status bar visible.

- (void) performAction: (ARAction *)  action
source: (NSString *)  source 

Perform an action, which can lead to an URL being opened, a new dimension being loaded or the same dimension being reloaded.

Parameters:
action the action to perform
source the identifier of the object that triggered this action.
- (void) refreshOnDistanceIfNecessary  

Check whether the distance is large enough to trigger a refresh.

- (void) refreshTimerDidFire: (NSTimer *)  aTimer  

Handle the refresh timer expiring; this should initite a dimension refresh.

Parameters:
aTimer the timer that expired.
- (void) scanTimerDidFire  

Handle the scan timer expiring; this should try to scan the current camera image for QR codes and try to load it if found.

- (void) setDisplayLink: (CADisplayLink *)  aLink  

Set the display link, stopping the current display link if it is already set.

Parameters:
aLink the new display link.
- (void) setNeedsUpdate  

Indicate that the views need to be updated.

- (void) setRefreshTimer: (NSTimer *)  aTimer  

Set the refresh timer, stopping the current timer if it is already set.

Parameters:
aTimer the new timer.
- (void) setScanTimer: (NSTimer *)  aTimer  

Set the scan timer, stopping the current timer if it is already set.

Parameters:
aTimer the new timer.
- (void) setState: (int)  state  

Change the current state of the application. This function controls the state machine, which means that it calls the didLeaveState, then sets the new state, and finally calls didEnterState for the newly entered state. If the new state is equal to the current state, neither function is called.

Parameters:
state the new state.
- (void) startDimensionRequestWithURL: (NSURL *)  aURL
type: (ARDimensionRequestType)  type
source: (NSString *)  source 

Start a dimension request, disabling updating and asset loading while the new dimension is updated.

Parameters:
aURL the URL that should be loaded.
type the type of request.
source the identifier of the object that triggered this event.
- (void) startRefreshingOnDistance  

Enable refreshing based on distance since the last dimension request. Does nothing if automatic updates should not be enabled, ie. when the dimension is outdated, the refresh distance is set to infinite or the refresh URL is not set.

- (void) startRefreshingOnTime  

Schedule a dimension refresh when the defined time interval expires. Does nothing if automatic updates should not be enabled, ie. when the dimension is outdated, the refresh time is set to infinite or the refresh URL is not set.

- (void) startScanning  

Start scanning for QR codes. Initializes the QR code scanner itself, but does not change the user interface.

- (void) stopRefreshingOnDistance  

Disable refreshing based on distance.

- (void) stopRefreshingOnTime  

Cancel the scheduled dimension refresh.

- (void) stopScanning  

Stop scanning for QR codes. Disabled and frees up resources used by the scanner, but does not change the user interface.

- (void) updateFeatureViews  

Update the features and radar, after the spatial state has changed.

- (void) updateIfNeeded  

Update the warning indicator views, and if the view was previously invalidated update the feature views.

- (void) updateWithDisplayLink: (CADisplayLink *)  sender  

Callback for the display link.

Parameters:
sender The sender of the message.
- (void) updateWithInterfaceOrientation: (UIInterfaceOrientation)  interfaceOrientation
prepareForAnimation: (BOOL)  animation 

Update the elements on the screen so that they are in the proper positions for the new orientation.

Parameters:
interfaceOrientation The new orientation of the device.
animation Whether a change in the interface orientation will be animated. If this is YES, the methods is expected to be called again (with animation = NO) after the animation has finished.
